NoteLiteral.En:
This ECIU challenge is intended for students who have completed a Degree in courses with an interest for the technical and engineering aspects of environment and sustainability

Please present a transcript of records listing the courses you have taken previously as well as a short motivation letter or statement (around 2 paragraphs is plenty) saying why you think you are suited to this ECIU Challenge. Please write in English.

Description.En:
## **Resilient cities**

Resilient cities are those that can withstand, adapt to, and recover from environmental, social, and economic shocks and stresses while maintaining essential functions, structures, and identities. Resilient cities prioritize sustainable and inclusive development, leveraging their assets and resources to build and maintain physical, social, and economic resilience. This includes investing in infrastructure, social services, emergency preparedness and response, and community engagement to build strong and adaptive communities that can thrive in situations of adversity. Resilient cities aim to ensure the safety, security, and well-being of their residents while promoting a sustainable and equitable future for all.

Title.En: Identify the major challenges of coastal cities

NoteLiteral.En: Identify new approaches towards tackling the major challenges connected with improving the resilience of coastal cities.
Apply previously developed competences, knowledge and attitudes gained through higher education in scientific fields connected with coastal zone sciences, urban renewal or related fields.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
## **Teaching Activities**

Within this broad theme of resilient coastal cities, learners will be motivated to identify challenges where they can apply the knowledge and skills they have developed during their academic paths to date, towards solutions that bring innovation, development, and impact to resilient coastal communities.  

In this way, ECIU learners from outside the University of Aveiro will join teams as part of a class of Portuguese students to work on their challenge including:  

- Mentoring and co-creation within the projects to be developed;  

- Tutorial sessions from experts in the involved fields;  

- Contact with regional stakeholders for gathering of information, ideas and collaboration on the solutions to be envisaged.

## **Schedule and mid-term workshop in Portugal**

Challenge meetings will take place each week over the course of the semester at times and on days to be arranged among challenge teams. Also, from **18 to 22 November a mid-term intensive workshop week** of all the challenge teams will take at the University of Aveiro Campus, including academic activities and a fun social programme. **If you are unable to attend the workshop** **but would still like to apply for the course**, please do not hesitate to apply since alternative arrangements for online participation can be made exceptionally.

## **Travel and Accommodation Costs**

The ECIU has set up a mobility fund to contribute to travel and accommodation of participants in ECIU courses and events. **We strongly recommend: before you submit your application, please contact the mobility officers for details of the procedures to apply for a mobility grant** for this ECIU micromodule. To contact them, just use the Contact Us form. Choose the option "I have a question on mobility support" ask our team what you need to do to apply for some travel funding. **If, however, given the holiday period, you do not get the funding before the application deadline** for the Challenge, just apply anyway so you don't get left out.  
   
 Please not that you will also receive full details of travel and accommodation arrangements for the event on the first day of the course.

This ECIU challenge focuses on the identification of societal solutions to improve the resilience of coastal cities while taking into account their characteristics and particularities as well as their potential to be social and economic hubs for innovation and development. The various challenges that this entails will bring together students from different fields, working together towards viable solutions to provide robustness and long-lasting impact towards resilient communities.

## **Admissions**

This Challenge is intended for students who have completed a Degree in a study programme with relevance for the technical and engineering aspects of environment and sustainability.  
  
Please present a transcript of records listing the courses you have taken previously as well as a short motivation letter or statement (around 2 paragraphs is plenty) saying why you think you are suited to this ECIU Challenge. Please write in English.
